questions.question: ___ had I entered the room when the phone rang.
questions.explanation: 'No sooner' is used with past perfect in inversion.

questions.question: Rarely ___ such a beautiful sight.
questions.explanation: After 'rarely', use inversion with perfect tenses.

questions.question: Only after the meeting ___ the issue clearly.
Seldom ___ such enthusiasm.
questions.explanation: 'Seldom' at the beginning of the sentence requires inversion.

questions.question: Not until he apologized ___ her forgive him.
questions.explanation: 'Not until' requires inversion in the second clause.

questions.question: Only by working hard ___ achieve your goals.
No sooner had he finished speaking ___ the lights went out.
questions.explanation: The correct collocation is 'No sooner... than...'

questions.question: Little ___ about the consequences of his decision.
questions.explanation: 'Little' at the start requires inversion with past simple.

questions.question: Never ___ such a complicated task before.
Under no circumstances ___ the door to strangers.
